column4: Ok, I was installing ubuntu and then it said that it couldn't finish installing and to check the CD/DVD, then when I went to restart the computer my Windows Vista won't come up, just a black screen with a cursor
what do I need to do to get Vista back?
my computer didn't come with any Vista disk
it won't apparently since there is something wrong with CD....wish it wouldn't have wiped out my computer before it installed
no dayo
I didn;t think it was going to take away Vista
nothing really
just a black screen with a cursor blinking
you've lost your boot loader and i have no idea how to reinstall it in Windows 7 (couldn't even do it with Vista, but i think i could do it with XP)
jschall if this helps??? Reinstall Grub after Windows Install / Boot off LiveCD / sudo grub / root (hd0,0) - setup (hd0) - exit
jschall i'm not certain... is there any boot loader right now?
jschall or just flashing cursor right?
there is a sort of autocomplet in grub... it's kinda neat
do you want to reinstall grub onto the MBR?
try tying "root (hd<press the tab key>" but cancel the line out (DO NOT PRESS ENTER)
it sould autocomplete a little and show you the possible drives
like the TAB button on your keyboard, it should automatically type in probably "(hd0,0)" sorta thing
is your prompt a ">"?
is your prompt a ">"
I thought you said you where in grub?
jschall I thought is was in grub?  but the grub prompt is a >
if you want to install grub to the MBR the line should look something like "root (hd0,0)" then press enter (step 1)
the next line is like "setup (hd0)"
then type "exit" (step 3 - last step)
